intro: Hypocalymma jessicae, commonly known as the Jessica's hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and produces its flowers during the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
